protocol_name: Total DNA "Midi" CTAB prep. for Zymoseptoria tritici
protocol_name_html: Total DNA "Midi" CTAB prep. for Zymoseptoria tritici
description: Bruce McDonald 1990 modified from Murray and Thompson

components.data: Prepare spores
components.name: Section

components.data:
Grow single spore isolate in 40-50mL YSB for 5-8 days at room temperature in shaker at 120-160rpm. Harvest spores by centrifuging in 50mL Falcon tube at approx. 3500rpm for 10-15min. Pour off supernanatant.

 

If not planning to use tissue immediately, transfer tissue to a 5 ml Falcon tube or leave in 50 ml Falcon tube.  Spin in centrifuge at full speed to pack tissue and store at -80 degrees Celcius. Lyophilize tissue on lyophilizer overnight or until completely dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Grow single spore isolate in 40-50mL YSB for 5-8 days at room temperature in shaker at 120-160rpm. Harvest spores by centrifuging in 50mL Falcon tube at approx. 3500rpm for 10-15min. Pour off supernanatant.

 

If not planning to use tissue immediately, transfer tissue to a 5 ml Falcon tube or leave in 50 ml Falcon tube.  Spin in centrifuge at full speed to pack tissue and store at -80 degrees Celcius. Lyophilize tissue on lyophilizer overnight or until completely dry.

components.data: Disrupt the cells
components.name: Section

components.data:
Place tissue in mortar and add liquid nitrogen (only if tissue is wet).  Grind into a fine powder with pestle.  Alternatively, grind lyophilized tissue with a glass rod directly in tube. Transfer powder to a 15 ml centrifuge tube (not more than 1/2 of tube) and immediately add 5 ml CTAB extraction buffer. Mix well by agitating and inverting tube several times.

 

Warning: CTAB extraction buffer is caustic. Gloves must be worn at all times when handling.

 

Reminder: Always make a fresh batch of CTAB extraction buffer each day. CTAB extraction buffer goes bad after 48 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Place tissue in mortar and add liquid nitrogen (only if tissue is wet).  Grind into a fine powder with pestle.  Alternatively, grind lyophilized tissue with a glass rod directly in tube. Transfer powder to a 15 ml centrifuge tube (not more than 1/2 of tube) and immediately add 5 ml CTAB extraction buffer. Mix well by agitating and inverting tube several times.

 

Warning: CTAB extraction buffer is caustic. Gloves must be worn at all times when handling.

 

Reminder: Always make a fresh batch of CTAB extraction buffer each day. CTAB extraction buffer goes bad after 48 hours.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data:
Place tube in 60oC H2O bath for 45-60 min., agitating tube every 10-15 minutes.

 

Caution: Occassionally the writing on the tube will begin to rub off or will be erased by chloroform or EtOH, therefore it is important in the following steps to frequently check the labeling on the tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Place tube in 60oC H2O bath for 45-60 min., agitating tube every 10-15 minutes.

 

Caution: Occassionally the writing on the tube will begin to rub off or will be erased by chloroform or EtOH, therefore it is important in the following steps to frequently check the labeling on the tubes.

components.data: Add 5 ml chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1, v:v) and emulsify mixture by gently inverting for 10-15 seconds. Do this step in the fume hood to minimize exposure to chloroform vapors. Centrifuge at 10,000 rpm (12,900 X g) for 15min to produce three layers. Transfer upper, aqueous phase to fresh 15 ml tube and do another chloroform extraction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5 ml chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1, v:v) and emulsify mixture by gently inverting for 10-15 seconds. Do this step in the fume hood to minimize exposure to chloroform vapors. Centrifuge at 10,000 rpm (12,900 X g) for 15min to produce three layers. Transfer upper, aqueous phase to fresh 15 ml tube and do another chloroform extraction.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add equal volume of isopropanol in the 15 ml tube and gently invert tube 15-20 times to precipitate DNA. Let tube sit at room temperature for 10 minutes before centrifuging at 9,000 rpm for 6 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add equal volume of isopropanol in the 15 ml tube and gently invert tube 15-20 times to precipitate DNA. Let tube sit at room temperature for 10 minutes before centrifuging at 9,000 rpm for 6 min.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Pour off supernatent and let pellet drain well on paper towels.  Resuspend pellet in 2.0 ml TE.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour off supernatent and let pellet drain well on paper towels.  Resuspend pellet in 2.0 ml TE.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Precipitate DNA by adding 0.5 volume (1.0 ml) 7.5 M NH4OAc and 2 volumes (4.0 ml) EtOH.  Mix by inverting tube 15-20 times and let sit for 10 minutes at room temperature.  Spin at 9,000 rpm (10,400 X g) for 6 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Precipitate DNA by adding 0.5 volume (1.0 ml) 7.5 M NH4OAc and 2 volumes (4.0 ml) EtOH.  Mix by inverting tube 15-20 times and let sit for 10 minutes at room temperature.  Spin at 9,000 rpm (10,400 X g) for 6 min.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Pour off supernatent  and let pellet drain well on paper towels. Resuspend pellet in 400 μl of TE. Spin down DNA in the centrifuge at top speed for three minutes to collect all liquid in the bottom of the tube.  Transfer the  DNA  solution to a 1.5 ml microfuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour off supernatent  and let pellet drain well on paper towels. Resuspend pellet in 400 μl of TE. Spin down DNA in the centrifuge at top speed for three minutes to collect all liquid in the bottom of the tube.  Transfer the  DNA  solution to a 1.5 ml microfuge tube.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Precipitate DNA by adding 0.5 volume (200 μl) 7.5 M NH4  OAc and 2 volumes (800 μl) EtOH.  Mix by inverting tube 15-20 times and let sit for 10 minutes at room temperatures.  Spin at top speed in microfuge for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Precipitate DNA by adding 0.5 volume (200 μl) 7.5 M NH4  OAc and 2 volumes (800 μl) EtOH.  Mix by inverting tube 15-20 times and let sit for 10 minutes at room temperatures.  Spin at top speed in microfuge for 10 minutes.

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Dry down pellet in vacuum chamber and resuspend in  50-500 µl TE. Store in 4 degreesn Celcius refrigerator overnight and quantify [DNA] on fluorometer. Store at 4 degrees Celcius until ready to digest.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry down pellet in vacuum chamber and resuspend in  50-500 µl TE. Store in 4 degreesn Celcius refrigerator overnight and quantify [DNA] on fluorometer. Store at 4 degrees Celcius until ready to digest.

components.data: Prepare CTAB buffer
components.name: Section

components.data:
CTAB Extraction Buffer  100 ml

 

            14.0 ml            5 M NaCl                  = 700 mM

            5.0 ml             1.0 M Tris (pH 8.0)    = 50 mM

            2.0 ml             0.5 M EDTA               = 10 mM

            10.0 ml           10% CTAB                 = 1 %

            1.0 ml             B Mercapto EtOH      = 1 %

           68.0 ml           Distilled water             to 100 ml

 

10% CTAB stock is good for six months at 4 C
components.name: Description
